text: What is the best way of creating networks, graphs in latex without learning TikZ? :smile: Are there any nice gui applications? I found LaTeXDraw and ipe quite unintuitive.

elements.text: What is the best way of creating networks, graphs in latex without learning TikZ?
Are there any nice gui applications? I found LaTeXDraw and ipe quite unintuitive.

text: Ask someone who knows tikz to do it for you :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: Ask someone who knows tikz to do it for you

text: Haha yeah. It just feels like there should be something simple for my needs of basic nodes, edges graph :smile:

elements.text: Haha yeah. It just feels like there should be something simple for my needs of basic nodes, edges graph

text: Tikz is nice! But I've never drawn graphs with it

elements.text: Tikz is nice! But I've never drawn graphs with it

text: I didn't like ipe too much, back in the days I tried it (about ten years ago)

elements.text: I didn't like ipe too much, back in the days I tried it (about ten years ago)

text: Have a look at the first few tutorials in the tikz manual, they are really quite nice. I think basic graphs are really simple in tikz.

elements.text: Have a look at the first few tutorials in the tikz manual, they are really quite nice. I think basic graphs are really simple in tikz.

text:
Lol I didn't know the inventor of TikZ is German:

From the manual:
"Für meinen Vater, damit er noch viele schöne TEX-Graphiken erschaffen kann. Till"

rough translation: "For my father such that he can create many beautiful TEX graphics"

elements.text:

text: He's also a professor at my university. :wink:
